brief_summary.textblock:
Comparison of functional outcome at 3 years after trapezio-metacarpal arthroplasty with
      trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon interposition.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objective is to compare functional outcome at 3 years after trapezio-metarcarpal
      arthroplasty with trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and tendon
      interposition. Literature values obtained by a recently published meta analysis1 will be
      used.

      Secondary objectives are:

        -  to compare functional outcome at 1 and at 5 years after trapezio-metarcarpal
           arthroplasty with trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with ligament reconstruction and
           tendon interposition

        -  to determine pre- and postop HR QOL

        -  Incidence of RLL at each follow up time point. Literature values from the same meta
           analysis1 will be used.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients with trapezio-metacarpal arthritis Eaton Stage of trapezio-metacarpal
             arthritis : Stage II - IV

          -  willing to return for follow up evaluation.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  local or systemic infections

          -  severe muscular, neurological or vascular deficiencies of the extremity involved

          -  bone destruction or poor bone to affect implant stability

          -  allergy to any of the components of the implant

study_pop.textblock:
patients with trapezio-metacarpal arthritis Eaton Stage of trapezio-metacarpal arthritis :
        Stage II - IV

clinical_study.official_title: Trapezio-metacarpal Arthroplasty: Comparison of ARPE Prosthesis With the Literature

primary_outcome.description: Functional outcome: hand function, strength (grip, key pinch & tip pinch)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: - functional outcomes at 1 and 5 years follow up after trapezio-metacarpal arthroplasty / trapeziectomy and trapeziectomy with LRTI.
- ROM (palmar and radial abduction)at 1, 3 & 5 years follow-up
- pre- and post Health Related QOL at 1, 3 & 5 years follow-up
- Incidence of Radiolucency lines at 1, 3 & 5 years follow-up

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
